svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 7, 2024" date: "2024-09-07"
Eth News and Links
CFTC regulation by enforcement & EF Research AMA
All core devs
* All Core Devs â€“ Consensus (ACDC) #141 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
Pectra-devnet-2 : Prysm fixed finality bug, deprecated Pectra-devnet-3 : testing
locally with ready clients, launch next week EIP7685 execution layer requests :
proposed change to return requests as opaque hex bytes, review at ACDE EIP6110
validator deposits onchain : proposed change to queue deposit requests to avoid
consensus layer DoS PeerDAS : PeerDAS-devnet-2 : testing locally with subset of
clients, launch soon Blob proof generation timing: discussed options for local
builders with lower spec hardware, proposal to pre-prepare blobs on consensus layer
Remove SSZ unions from consensus spec proposal (not used in production)
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Pectra-devnet-2 : Prysm fixed finality bug,
deprecated Pectra-devnet-3 : testing locally with ready clients, launch next week
EIP7685 execution layer requests : proposed change to return requests as opaque hex
bytes, review at ACDE EIP6110 validator deposits onchain : proposed change to queue
deposit requests to avoid consensus layer DoS PeerDAS : PeerDAS-devnet-2 : testing
locally with subset of clients, launch soon Blob proof generation timing: discussed
options for local builders with lower spec hardware, proposal to pre-prepare blobs on
consensus layer Remove SSZ unions from consensus spec proposal (not used in
production)
* Pectra-devnet-2 : Prysm fixed finality bug, deprecated
Pectra-devnet-2 : Prysm fixed finality bug, deprecated
* Pectra-devnet-3 : testing locally with ready clients, launch next week
Pectra-devnet-3 : testing locally with ready clients, launch next week
* EIP7685 execution layer requests : proposed change to return requests as opaque hex
bytes, review at ACDE
* EIP6110 validator deposits onchain : proposed change to queue deposit requests to
avoid consensus layer DoS
EIP6110 validator deposits onchain : proposed change to queue deposit requests to
* PeerDAS : PeerDAS-devnet-2 : testing locally with subset of clients, launch soon
Blob proof generation timing: discussed options for local builders with lower spec
hardware, proposal to pre-prepare blobs on consensus layer
PeerDAS :
* PeerDAS-devnet-2 : testing locally with subset of clients, launch soon
PeerDAS-devnet-2 : testing locally with subset of clients, launch soon
* Blob proof generation timing: discussed options for local builders with lower spec
* Remove SSZ unions from consensus spec proposal (not used in production)
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade
* Pectra testing call #3
Pectra testing call #3
* EOF implementers call #57 : discussed EIP7761 ISCONTRACT & alternatives to support
ERC721/1155 safe transfer
EOF implementers call #57 : discussed EIP7761 ISCONTRACT & alternatives to support
* PeerDAS breakout #7 : blob proofs could take up to 1 second to compute
PeerDAS breakout #7 : blob proofs could take up to 1 second to compute
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.4% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.4% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 36% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 36%
Consensus layer: Prysm 36%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Research
* EF Research AMA on r/Ethereum: ETH value accrual , L1 scaling , blob price discovery
, L2 sequencer decentralization , zk research , credible neutrality , issuance , EF
runway , pivot Fusaka upgrade from Verkle and more
EF Research AMA on r/Ethereum:
* ETH value accrual , L1 scaling , blob price discovery , L2 sequencer
decentralization , zk research , credible neutrality , issuance , EF runway , pivot
Fusaka upgrade from Verkle and more
* ERC4337 embedded fee markets , solutions to prevent users from overpaying
ERC4337 embedded fee markets , solutions to prevent users from overpaying
Client Releases
* Execution layer: Erigon v3.0.0-alpha3 : 30% reduction of latest state, 2x reduction
in chaindata, 2x less RAM & prune doesn't impact chain-tip performance; resync
required
* Erigon v3.0.0-alpha3 : 30% reduction of latest state, 2x reduction in chaindata, 2x
less RAM & prune doesn't impact chain-tip performance; resync required
Layer 2
* Arbitrum Stylus live on Arbitrum One & Nova, adds Web Assembly VM, write contracts
in languages that compile into WASM such as Rust, composable with EVM contracts
Arbitrum Stylus live on Arbitrum One & Nova, adds Web Assembly VM, write contracts in
languages that compile into WASM such as Rust, composable with EVM contracts
* Base plan to increase gas target by 1 Mgas/s weekly towards goal of 1 Ggas/s
Blobspace saturation projected for February
Base plan to increase gas target by 1 Mgas/s weekly towards goal of 1 Ggas/s
* Blobspace saturation projected for February
* Matter Labs (ZKsync) laid off ~16% of team
Matter Labs (ZKsync) laid off ~16% of team
For Stakers
* Geth node on Banana Pi BPI-F3 RISCV board , consensus clients struggle to run
currently
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7762 : Increase MIN_BASE_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS
(to speed up price discovery)
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* EIP7762 : Increase MIN_BASE_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS (to speed up price discovery)
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7763 : App keys for fully embedded accounts ERC7764 :
Buyer-seller negotiable pricing
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7763 : App keys for fully embedded accounts
ERC7763 : App keys for fully embedded accounts
* ERC7764 : Buyer-seller negotiable pricing
ERC7764 : Buyer-seller negotiable pricing
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.8.27 : require with custom errors, caching of optimized IR for faster
compilation and parser support for transient storage variables
Solidity v0.8.27 : require with custom errors, caching of optimized IR for faster
* Scaffold-ETH 2 extensions hackathon finalists
Scaffold-ETH 2 extensions hackathon finalists
* EVMole v0.4 (function selector extractor): improved accuracy of function state
mutability extraction and improved speed for Python & JavaScript
EVMole v0.4 (function selector extractor): improved accuracy of function state
* Supersim : simulate interoperable OP Stack Superchain locally
Supersim : simulate interoperable OP Stack Superchain locally
* CTF Challenges : Uniswap V2 ERC4626 vulnerable vault
CTF Challenges : Uniswap V2 ERC4626 vulnerable vault
Security
* Penpie $27M exploit on mainnet & Arbitrum via reentrancy
Penpie $27M exploit on mainnet & Arbitrum via reentrancy
* L2 DAI deployer compromised allowing attacker to deploy contracts on other L2s with
same address as DAI on Optimism & Arbitrum
L2 DAI deployer compromised allowing attacker to deploy contracts on other L2s with
* Vyper compiler added to EF bounty program
Vyper compiler added to EF bounty program
Ecosystem
* Devcon community hub proposals
Devcon community hub proposals
* ETHAccra hackathon projects
ETHAccra hackathon projects
Job Listings
* Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
* Nomos is hiring Business Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
Nomos is hiring Business Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
* Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
* Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 0.4 to 53.4 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 24.0 gwei 16k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 0.4 to 53.4 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.0 gwei
Gas: 0.4 to 53.4 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.0 gwei
* 16k ETH net issuance this week
16k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,165 - $2,548, currently $2,233, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,165 - $2,548, currently $2,233, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.041 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.041 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
* Euler v2 live, modular lending, use vaults as collateral in other vaults
Euler v2 live, modular lending, use vaults as collateral in other vaults
* Lextek v0: onchain legal forms live on Base, starting with SAFE & DEAL (escrow &
invoicing)
Lextek v0: onchain legal forms live on Base, starting with SAFE & DEAL (escrow &
* Snapshot v2 : discussions view, delegate dashboard and improved voting/proposal UX,
beta
Snapshot v2 : discussions view, delegate dashboard and improved voting/proposal UX,
* Atomic : exercise challenges live on Base, stake USDC, log Strava workouts & claim
stake
Atomic : exercise challenges live on Base, stake USDC, log Strava workouts & claim
Regulation/business/tokens
* CFTC regulation by enforcement: Dissent by Commissioner Mersinger & Commissioner
Pham of Uniswap enforcement for not blocking leverage tokens
CFTC regulation by enforcement:
* Dissent by Commissioner Mersinger & Commissioner Pham of Uniswap enforcement for not
blocking leverage tokens
* Kalshi won against CFTC to list prediction market for control of US congress
Kalshi won against CFTC to list prediction market for control of US congress
* Galois Capital settled with SEC for using a disclosed non-qualified custodian when
the SEC wonâ€™t approve custodians
Galois Capital settled with SEC for using a disclosed non-qualified custodian when the
SEC wonâ€™t approve custodians
* FBI : North Korea targeting crypto projects via social engineering
FBI : North Korea targeting crypto projects via social engineering
General
* Vitalik: glue & coprocessor architecture , central glue (high generality but low
efficiency) shuttles data between coprocessors (low generality buy high efficiency)
e.g. EVM & precompiles
Vitalik: glue & coprocessor architecture , central glue (high generality but low
* EUCLEAK : Infineon ECDSA side-channel vulnerability, requires physical access,
impacts some YubiKeys
EUCLEAK : Infineon ECDSA side-channel vulnerability, requires physical access, impacts
some YubiKeys
* Notes on extractable witness encryption for KZG commitments and efficient Laconic OT
Notes on extractable witness encryption for KZG commitments and efficient Laconic OT
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-7-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
